comment.body:
> [iyogo887vyg87oy8](#comment_1_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof): How much does it cost?

In 2003 (in Russia :) ) it cost about $20. As it is now, I do not know. That aerobatics/skydive club near Moscow, where I went, had already closed many years ago..

> [iyogo887vyg87oy8](#comment_2_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof): That's a very good price!

Over the past years, prices have risen. I now looked at the prices near Moscow. An ordinary jump with a parachute costs 2500-3500 rubles. That's about $43 .. $61. In tandem with the instructor $90 .. $160. Independent jumps of athletes from $15 (with your own parachute, probably?).
Heck. It seems that Google now forbids showing its built-in video on localhost? Freaks.

> [268](#comment_1_1BpWqMrcVcqAYpzkutTbh9QYSGv3SkaPCx): The spread of computers and smart phones, higher pressure of life, distrust to the social media, they all counts.

This all also plays a role, but, in my opinion, the passivity of television plays an important role here. Social networks also provide an opportunity for escapism, but provide a wider choice of habitat :) And to look at photos of cats and put them like it easier than even trying to get into the plot of a movie or a TV show and at the same time you feel your influence on the process :D
Replaced YouTube video with ZeroUp clone.

> [4567l](#comment_1_1Lh89nAb4YeizEER15JUcpscy37mZwDUer): Great photo, love it.

Thank you :)

> [trooper](#comment_1_1Nyvgpgzk7BEEHs1TeTRwAtEDhF2txevSe): and how it looks now?

I have not lived there for more than three years, so I do not know how right now. But in 2014, approximately in the same perspective, everything looked so :)
